sentences.en: A small boy tumbled off the porch.
sentences.cn: 一个小男孩从门廊上摔了下去。

sentences.en: All the pups were having a rough - and - tumble in the garden.
sentences.cn: 小狗都正在花园里又叫又闹.

sentences.en: Both of the wrestlers tried to tumble the adversary with all their strength.
sentences.cn: 双方摔跤运动员都使出了全身气力想把对手摔倒.

sentences.en: Children tumble over each other in play.
sentences.cn: 孩子们玩耍时相互连身翻滚.

sentences.en: Ever and again they heard the same cry from the tumble - down building.
sentences.cn: 他们不时地从震倒的房屋中听到同样的呼叫声.

sentences.en: He enjoys rough and tumble play.
He injured his ribs in a tumble from his horse.
sentences.cn: 他从马背上摔下来时伤到了肋骨。

sentences.en: He took a tumble down the stairs.
It’s possible that stocks could take a tumble next year.
sentences.cn: 明年股票有可能会大跌。

sentences.en: Many mothers and children tumble into poverty after divorce.
sentences.cn: 很多母亲和孩子在离婚后陷入贫困。

sentences.en: Oil prices took a tumble yesterday.
Some fear he is too thin-skinned to survive the rough-and-tumble of a presidential campaign.
sentences.cn: 有人担心他脸皮太薄，经受不住总统选举的激烈竞争。

sentences.en: The outer walls looked likely to tumble down in a stiff wind.
sentences.cn: 外墙看起来一刮强风就会倒塌。

sentences.en: the rough and tumble of politics
The toddlers often join in the rough and tumble of the older children's games.
sentences.cn: 刚会走路的小孩经常跟着大一些的孩子一起打打闹闹.

sentences.en: Waterfalls crash and tumble over rocks.
sentences.cn: 瀑布飞流直溅，冲刷着岩石。

words.tran_cn: 不倒翁（玩具）；杂技演员；翻筋斗者；一杯的容量；滚筒；平底玻璃杯
跌倒；毁灭；被绊倒（tumble的ing形式）
摔倒；倒塌；滚动；打滚；仓惶地行动

trans.tran_cn: 摔倒，（价格，价值等）暴跌，混乱，翻筋斗
trans.tran_en: a fall, especially from a high place or level

trans.tran_cn: 突然跌倒， 突然下跌； 倒塌
trans.tran_en: to fall down quickly and suddenly, especially with a rolling movement

trans.tran_cn: 跌倒，摔倒，被绊倒，倒塌，翻来覆去，翻腾
trans.tran_en: to fall down quickly and suddenly, especially with a rolling movement
to fall down quickly and suddenly, especially with a rolling movement

trans.tran_cn: 使跌倒，使完全翻转，弄乱，搞乱，推翻，颠覆
跌倒，跌落；摇摇欲坠；使倾覆
trans.tran_en: to fall down quickly and suddenly, especially with a rolling movement
